commit_message:
Remove old authtoken options

Since we are in ocata lets remove all old parameters in api
to configure the keystone_authtoken section

Change-Id: I4dc0bd544f91fd52ad437b4c3ebbd16a43895726
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/49/394749/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # (Optional) If true, explicitly allow TLS without checking server cert # against any certificate authorities. WARNING: not recommended. Use with # caution. # Defaults to $:os_service_default# (Optional) Config Section from which to load plugin specific options # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Authentication type to load # Defaults to 'password'.# (Optional) Complete public Identity API endpoint. # Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:5000'.# (Optional) API version of the admin Identity API endpoint. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Env key for the swift cache. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) A PEM encoded Certificate Authority to use when verifying HTTPs # connections. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Required if identity server requires client certificate # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) If true, the revocation list will be checked for cached tokens. # This requires that PKI tokens are configured on the identity server. # boolean value. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Do not handle authorization requests within the middleware, but # delegate the authorization decision to downstream WSGI components. Boolean # value # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Used to control the use and type of token binding. Can be set # to: "disabled" to not check token binding. "permissive" (default) to # validate binding information if the bind type is of a form known to the # server and ignore it if not. "strict" like "permissive" but if the bind # type is unknown the token will be rejected. "required" any form of token # binding is needed to be allowed. Finally the name of a binding method that # must be present in tokens. String value. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Hash algorithms to use for hashing PKI tokens. This may be a # single algorithm or multiple. The algorithms are those supported by Python # standard hashlib.new(). The hashes will be tried in the order given, so put # the preferred one first for performance. The result of the first hash will # be stored in the cache. This will typically be set to multiple values only # while migrating from a less secure algorithm to a more secure one. Once all # the old tokens are expired this option should be set to a single value for # better performance. List value. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Request timeout value for communicating with Identity API # server. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) How many times are we trying to reconnect when communicating # with Identity API Server. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Indicate whether to set the X-Service-Catalog header. If False, # middleware will not ask for service catalog on token validation and will # not set the X-Service-Catalog header. Boolean value. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Required if identity server requires client certificate # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Number of seconds that an operation will wait to get a memcached # client connection from the pool. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Number of seconds memcached server is considered dead before it # is tried again. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Maximum total number of open connections to every memcached # server. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Number of seconds a connection to memcached is held unused in # the pool before it is closed. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Number of seconds a connection to memcached is held unused in # the pool before it is closed. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional, mandatory if memcache_security_strategy is defined) This string # is used for key derivation. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) If defined, indicate whether token data should be authenticated # or authenticated and encrypted. If MAC, token data is authenticated (with # HMAC) in the cache. If ENCRYPT, token data is encrypted and authenticated in the # cache. If the value is not one of these options or empty, auth_token will # raise an exception on initialization. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Use the advanced (eventlet safe) memcached client pool. The # advanced pool will only work under python 2.x Boolean value # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Optionally specify a list of memcached server(s) to use for # caching. If left undefined, tokens will instead be cached in-process. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) The region in which the identity server can be found. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Determines the frequency at which the list of revoked tokens is # retrieved from the Identity service (in seconds). A high number of # revocation events combined with a low cache duration may significantly # reduce performance. Only valid for PKI tokens. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Directory used to cache files related to PKI tokens. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) In order to prevent excessive effort spent validating tokens, # the middleware caches previously-seen tokens for a configurable duration # (in seconds). Set to -1 to disable caching completely. commit_message:
Use new naming for authtoken variables

change old pattern tenant for project_name
drop _real suffix

Change-Id: I7bc232caedecfebf7ebe00923eff515e3c43b0c5

added_lines: $keystone_project_name = $::cinder::keystone::authtoken::project_name $keystone_username = $::cinder::keystone::authtoken::username $keystone_password = $::cinder::keystone::authtoken::password 'command' => "cinder --os-auth-url ${::cinder::keystone::authtoken::auth_uri} --os-project-name ${keystone_project_name} --os-username ${keystone_username} --os-password ${keystone_password} list",

commit_message:
Fix common options position in params.pp

These parameters are common for both systems,
they could be moved out from 'case'.

Change-Id: I59e4bd67a53784f19edc18559dd5eb13a026153a

commit_message:
Enable graphical login banner

This patch enables login warning banners on graphical logins. Docs
will be in a follow-on patch.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I9aa7e2c2691b0d2c0659826037909bf43cef0505
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/46/397246/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - /etc/dconf/db/gdm.d/ - RHEL-07-010030 - RHEL-07-010031 - name: Create a GDM profile for displaying a login banner copy: src: dconf-profile-gdm dest: /etc/dconf/profile/gdm when: - dconf_check.stat.exists notify: - dconf update tags: - graphical - medium - RHEL-07-010030 - RHEL-07-010031 - name: Create a GDM keyfile for machine-wide settings template: src: dconf-gdm-banner-message.j2 dest: "{{ item }}" with_items: - /etc/dconf/db/gdm.d/01-banner-message - /etc/dconf/db/local.d/01-banner-message when: - dconf_check.stat.exists notify: - dconf update tags: - graphical - medium - RHEL-07-010030 - RHEL-07-010031

subject: Add support for BIOS local boot for GPT label

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-15 19:28:54.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_lib/tests/test_disk_utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/gpt-bios-425e703770fae46d.yaml', 'ironic_lib/disk_utils.py', 'ironic_lib/disk_partitioner.py', 'ironic_lib/tests/test_disk_partitioner.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-lib/commit/d3251b3667ab98020b861d808a21a25dd718b1f4', 'message': "Add support for BIOS local boot for GPT label

Ironic doesn't support local booting of images in BIOS boot mode
when the disk_label is GPT. The current changes creates BIOS Boot
partition when the disk_label is chosen as gpt. The partition size
is a configurable parameter.

Change-Id: Iade60da0316b8f1c0bf8ce4c79931c1105d19cec

(cherry picked from commit c6d4f0f463974a3a88eadb22c175c796556cc755)
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for BIOS local boot for GPT label

Ironic doesn't support local booting of images in BIOS boot mode
when the disk_label is GPT. The current changes creates BIOS Boot
partition when the disk_label is chosen as gpt. The partition size
is a configurable parameter.

Change-Id: Iade60da0316b8f1c0bf8ce4c79931c1105d19cec
Closes-bug: #1563291
(cherry picked from commit c6d4f0f463974a3a88eadb22c175c796556cc755)

added_lines: Diskimage-builder script for creating Octavia Amphora images ============================================================ Octavia is an operator-grade reference implementation for Load Balancing as a Service (LBaaS) for OpenStack. The component of Octavia that does the load balancing is known as amphora. Amphora may be a virtual machine, may be a container, or may run on bare metal. Creating images for bare metal amphora installs is outside the scope of this version but may be added in a future release. Prerequisites ============= This script assumes a typical Linux environment and was developed on Ubuntu 12.04.5 LTS. Python pip should be installed as well as the following python modules: | argparse | Babel>=1.3 | dib-utils | PyYAML Your cache directory should have at least 1GB available, the working directory will need ~1.5GB, and your image destination will need ~500MB The script expects to find the diskimage-builder and tripleo-image-elements git repositories one directory above the Octavia git repository. | /<some directory>/octavia | /<some directory>/diskimage-builder | /<some directory>/tripleo-image-elements | cd /<some directory> | git clone https://github.com/openstack/octavia.git | git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/diskimage-builder.git | git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements.git These paths can be overriden with the following environment variables: | OCTAVIA_REPO_PATH = /<some directory>/octavia | DIB_REPO_PATH = /<some directory>/diskimage-builder | DIB_ELEMENTS = /<some directory>/diskimage-builder/elements | ELEMENTS_REPO_PATH = /<some directory>/tripleo-image-elements | TRIPLEO_ELEMENTS_PATH = /<some directory>/tripleo-image-elements/elements The following packages are required on each platform: Ubuntu and Fedora: qemu kpartx git CentOS and RedHat Enterprise Linux: qemu-kvm qemu-img kpartx git CentOS requires the EPEL repo and python-argparse: .. code:: bash $ sudo rpm -Uvh --force http://mirrors.kernel.org/fedora-epel/6/i386/epel-release-6-8.noarch.rpm $ yum install python-argparse Test Prerequisites ------------------ The tox image tests require libguestfs-tools 1.24 or newer. Libguestfs allows testing the Amphora image without requiring root privledges. On Ubuntu systems you also need to give read access to the kernels for the user running the tests: .. code:: bash $ sudo chmod 0644 /boot/vmlinuz* Tests were run on Ubuntu 14.04.1 LTS during development. Usage ===== This script and associated elements will build Amphora images. Current support is with an Ubuntu base OS and HAProxy. The script can use Fedora or CentOS as a base OS but these will not initially be tested or supported. As the project progresses and/or the diskimage-builder project adds support for additional base OS options they may become available for Amphora images. This does not mean that they are necessarily supported or tested. The script will use environment variables to customize the build beyond the Octavia project defaults, such as adding elements. The supported and tested image is created by using the diskimage-create.sh defaults (no command line parameters or environment variables set). As the project progresses we may add additional supported configurations. Command syntax: .. line-block:: $ diskimage-create.sh [-a i386 | **amd64** | armhf ] [-b **ovs** ] [-c **~/.cache/image-create** | <cache directory> ] [-h] [-i **ubuntu** | fedora | centos ] [-o **distributor** | <filename> ] [-r <root password> ] [-s **5** | <size in GB> ] [-t **qcow2** | tar ] [-v] [-w <working directory> ] '-a' is the architecture type for the image (default: amd64) '-b' is the backend type (default: ovs) '-c' is the path to the cache directory (default: ~/.cache/image-create) '-h' display help message '-i' is the base OS (default: ubuntu) '-o' is the output image file name '-r' enable the root account in the generated image (default: disabled) '-s' is the image size to produce in gigabytes (default: 5) '-t' is the image type (default: qcow2) '-v' display the script version '-w' working directory for image building (default: .) Environment Variables ===================== These are optional environment variables that can be set to override the script defaults. CLOUD_INIT_DATASOURCES - Comma seperated list of cloud-int datasources - Default: ConfigDrive - Options: NoCloud, ConfigDrive, OVF, MAAS, Ec2, <others> - Reference: https://launchpad.net/cloud-init BASE_OS_MIRROR - URL to a mirror for the base OS selected - Default: None DIB_ELEMENTS - Override the elements used to build the image - Default: None DIB_LOCAL_ELEMENTS - Elements to add to the build (requires DIB_LOCAL_ELEMENTS_PATH be specified) - Default: None DIB_LOCAL_ELEMENTS_PATH - Path to the local elements directory - Default: None DIB_REPO_PATH - Directory containing diskimage-builder - Default: <directory above OCTAVIA_HOME>/diskimage-builder - Reference: https://github.com/openstack/diskimage-builder ELEMENTS_PATH - Directory that contains the default elements - Default: <ELEMENTS_REPO_PATH>/elements - Reference: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-image-elements ELEMENTS_REPO_PATH - Directory containing tripleo-image-elements - Default: <directory above OCTAVIA_HOME>/tripleo-image-elements - Reference: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-image-elements OCTAVIA_REPO_PATH - Directory containing octavia - <directory above the script location> - Reference: https://github.com/openstack/octavia Container Support ================= The Docker command line required to import a tar file created with this script is: .. code:: bash $ docker import - image:distributor < distributor.tar References ========== This documentation and script(s) leverage prior work by the OpenStack TripleO and Sahara teams. Thank you to everyone that worked on them for providing a great foundation for creating Octavia Amphora images. | https://github.com/openstack/diskimage-builder | https://github.com/openstack/diskimage-builder/blob/master/docs/docker.md | https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-image-elements | https://github.com/openstack/sahara-image-elements Copyright ========= Copyright 2014 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. All Rights Reserved. Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at | http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License.

added_lines: """create amphora cluster table Revision ID: e9573113afd2 Revises: 94135f95e292 Create Date: 2016-06-08 17:23:13.405002 """ # revision identifiers, used by Alembic. revision = 'e9573113afd2' down_revision = '94135f95e292' from alembic import op import sqlalchemy as sa from sqlalchemy import sql def upgrade(): op.create_table( u'amphora_cluster', sa.Column(u'id', sa.String(36), nullable=False), sa.Column(u'cluster_name', sa.String(36), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'cooldown', sa.Integer(), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'desired_capacity', sa.Integer(), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'max_size', sa.Integer(), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'min_size', sa.Integer(), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'measurement_period', sa.Integer(), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'number_measurement_periods', sa.Integer(), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'scale_up_threshold', sa.Integer(), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'scale_down_threshold', sa.Integer(), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'load_balancer_id', sa.String(36), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'distributor_id', sa.String(36), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'provisioning_status', sa.String(16), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'operating_status', sa.String(16), nullable=True), sa.Column(u'enabled', sa.Boolean(), nullable=True), sa.PrimaryKeyConstraint(u'id'), sa.ForeignKeyConstraint([u'load_balancer_id'], [u'load_balancer.id'], name=u'fk_amphora_cluster_load_balancer_id'), sa.ForeignKeyConstraint([u'distributor_id'], [u'distributor.id'], name=u'fk_amphora_cluster_distributor_id'), sa.ForeignKeyConstraint([u'provisioning_status'], [u'provisioning_status.name'], name=u'fk_amphora_cluster_provisioning_status_name'), sa.ForeignKeyConstraint([u'operating_status'], [u'operating_status.name'], name=u'fk_amphora_cluster_operating_status_name') ) def downgrade(): op.drop_table(u'amphora_cluster')

ACTIVE-ACTIVE Topology - Initial Cluster Manager

Change-Id: I173ee6d9f3ebe83d59cbf359c2e76af06884060f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/25/336925/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # Copyright 2016 IBM # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_log import log as logging from octavia.amphorae.cluster_manager.drivers.driver_base import \ AmphoraClusterDriver as DriverBase LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class NoopManager(object): def __init__(self): super(NoopManager, self).__init__() self.AmphoraClusterManagerConfig = {} def create_cluster_for_lb(self, loadbalancer): LOG.debug("Amphora Cluster Manager %s no-op, load_balancer_id %s", self.__class__.__name__, loadbalancer.id) self.AmphoraClusterManagerConfig[loadbalancer] = ( loadbalancer, 'create_cluster_for_lb') def create_amphorae(self, amphora_cluster): LOG.debug("Amphora Cluster Manager %s no-op, cluster %s", self.__class__.__name__, amphora_cluster.id) self.AmphoraClusterManagerConfig[amphora_cluster] = (amphora_cluster, 'create_amphorae') def delete_cluster_for_lb(self, loadbalancer): LOG.debug("Amphora Cluster Manager %s no-op, load_balancer_id %s", self.__class__.__name__, loadbalancer.id) self.AmphoraClusterManagerConfig[loadbalancer] = ( loadbalancer, 'delete_cluster_for_lb') def finalize_amphora_cluster(self, amphora_cluster): LOG.debug("Amphora Cluster Manager %s no-op, load_balancer_id %s", self.__class__.__name__, amphora_cluster.load_balancer_id) self.AmphoraClusterManagerConfig[amphora_cluster] = ( amphora_cluster, 'finalize_amphora_cluster') def recover_from_amphora_failure(self, failed_amphora, loadbalancer): LOG.debug("Amphora Cluster Manager %s no-op, load_balancer_id %s", self.__class__.__name__, loadbalancer.id) self.AmphoraClusterManagerConfig[(failed_amphora, loadbalancer)] = ( (failed_amphora, loadbalancer), 'recover_from_amphora_failure') def grow_cluster_for_lb(self, loadbalancer): LOG.debug("Amphora Cluster Manager %s no-op, load_balancer_id %s", self.__class__.__name__, loadbalancer.id) self.AmphoraClusterManagerConfig[loadbalancer] = ( loadbalancer, 'grow_cluster_for_lb') def shrink_cluster_for_lb(self, loadbalancer): LOG.debug("Amphora Cluster Manager %s no-op, load_balancer_id %s", self.__class__.__name__, loadbalancer.id) self.AmphoraClusterManagerConfig[loadbalancer] = ( loadbalancer, 'shrink_cluster_for_lb') class NoopAmphoraClusterDriver(DriverBase): def __init__(self): super(NoopAmphoraClusterDriver, self).__init__() self.driver = NoopManager() def create_cluster_for_lb(self, loadbalancer): self.driver.create_cluster_for_lb(loadbalancer) return None def delete_cluster_for_lb(self, loadbalancer): self.driver.delete_cluster_for_lb(loadbalancer) return True def create_amphorae(self, amphora_cluster): self.driver.create_amphorae(amphora_cluster) return True def finalize_amphora_cluster(self, amphora_cluster): self.driver.finalize_amphora_cluster(amphora_cluster) return True def recover_from_amphora_failure(self, failed_amphora, loadbalancer): self.driver.recover_from_amphora_failure(failed_amphora, loadbalancer) return True def grow_cluster_for_lb(self, loadbalancer): self.driver.grow_cluster_for_lb(loadbalancer) return True def shrink_cluster_for_lb(self, loadbalancer): self.driver.shrink_cluster_for_lb(loadbalancer) return True

commit_message:
Basic shared pools scenario test

This migrates the test_shared_pools scenario test from neturon-lbaas.

Change-Id: I17fef583d26d1a3b67e0b26254231a954b778f5d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/93/378993/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Rackspace Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest import test from octavia.tests.tempest.v1.scenario import base class TestSharedPools(base.BaseTestCase): @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_shared_pools(self): """This test checks load balancing with shared pools. The following is the scenario outline: 1. Boot 1 instance. 2. SSH to instance and start two servers listening on different ports. 3. Create a pool. 4. Create 2 listeners. 5. Create a load balancer with two members associated to the two servers on the instance, and with ROUND_ROBIN algorithm. 6. Send NUM requests to one listener's floating ip and check that they are shared between the two members. 7. Send NUM requests to the other listener's floating ip and check that they are shared between the two members. """ self._create_server('server1') self._start_servers() # automatically creates first listener on port 80 self._create_load_balancer() # create second listener on port 8080 self._create_listener(load_balancer_id=self.load_balancer['id'], protocol_port=8080, default_pool_id=self.pool['id']) self._wait_for_load_balancer_status(self.load_balancer['id']) # check via first listener's default port 80 self._check_load_balancing() # check via second listener's port 8080 self._check_load_balancing(port=8080)

commit_message:
Basic session persistence scenario test

This migrates the test_session_persistence scenario test from
neutron-lbaas.

Change-Id: I429ec52113deb8e64282f33afddcadf6e1d9b841
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/26/379826/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Mirantis Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest import test from octavia.tests.tempest.v1.scenario import base class TestSessionPersistence(base.BaseTestCase): @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_session_persistence(self): """This test checks checks load balancing with session persistence. The following is the scenario outline: 1. Boot two instances. 2. SSH to the instance and start two servers. 3. Create a pool with SOURCE_IP session persistence type. 4. Create a load balancer with two members and with ROUND_ROBIN algorithm. 5. Send 10 requests to the floating ip, associated with the VIP, and make sure all the requests from the same ip are processed by the same member of the pool. 6. Change session persistence type of the pool to HTTP_COOKIE. 7. Check that this session persistence type also forces all the requests containing the same cookie to hit the same member of the pool. 8. Change session persistence type of the pool to APP_COOKIE. 9. Perform the same check. 10. Turn session persistence off and check that the requests are again distributed according to the ROUND_ROBIN algorithm. """ self._create_server('server1') self._start_servers() self._create_load_balancer(persistence_type="SOURCE_IP") self._check_source_ip_persistence() self._update_pool_session_persistence("HTTP_COOKIE") self._check_cookie_session_persistence() self._update_pool_session_persistence("APP_COOKIE", cookie_name="JSESSIONID") self._check_cookie_session_persistence() self._update_pool_session_persistence() self._check_load_balancing()

added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest import test from octavia.tests.tempest.v1.scenario import base class TestHealthMonitorBasic(base.BaseTestCase): @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_health_monitor_basic(self): """This test checks load balancing with health monitor. The following is the scenario outline: 1. Create two instances. 2. SSH to the instances and start two servers: primary and secondary. 3. Create a load balancer, with two members and with ROUND_ROBIN algorithm, associate the VIP with a floating ip. 4. Create a health monitor. 5. Send NUM requests to the floating ip and check that they are shared between the two servers. 6. Disable the primary server and validate the traffic is being sent only to the secondary server. """ self._create_servers() self._start_servers() self._create_load_balancer() self._create_health_monitor() self._check_load_balancing() # stopping the primary server self._stop_server() # Asserting the traffic is sent only to the secondary server self._traffic_validation_after_stopping_server()

commit_message:
devstack: Stop setting route pointing back to tenant router

The is the networking-odl counter part of devstack patch.
change set of df5e69114fa2af663c50e734b4a842c727e6a7e9
change id of If45e3fc15c050cfbac11b57c1eaf137dd7ed816f
This patch removes both IPv4/IPv6 routes for tenant router
unlike the patch of devstack.

> Stop setting route pointing back to tenant router
>
> This removes the logic to add a route pointing to the IPv4
> tenant private network range since the router is performing
> SNAT. If reaching the IPs via the route worked at all, it was
> by accident since this behavior is certainly not guaranteed
> by Neutron.

Change-Id: Ib4c8b0e1737ce6b2e328dd76b432ac137e1173aa

commit_message:
Replace deprecated LOG.warn with LOG.warning

LOG.warn is deprecated in Python 3 [1].
This change switches it to the non-deprecated LOG.warning

[1]https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning

Closes-Bug: #1508442
Change-Id: If57939c68f6bb185d7e19e3fbc2a26fca3ecb5d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ofagent refs/changes/78/326778/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.warning(_LW("VIF port: %s has no ofport configured, " "and might not be able to transmit"), LOG.warning(_LW("Device %s not defined on plugin"), device)
deleted_lines: LOG.warn(_LW("VIF port: %s has no ofport configured, " "and might not be able to transmit"), LOG.warn(_LW("Device %s not defined on plugin"), device)

commit_message:
Some classes not define __ne__() built-in function

Some classes defines __eq__() built-in function, but does
not define __ne__() built-in function, so self.assertEqual works
but self.assertNotEqual does not work at all in this test case in
python2. This patch will fix it.

Change-Id: Ia5789c773959e75e8c1c99d82129cac1df30cc64
Closes-Bug: #1586268
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/33/343133/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __ne__(self, other): return not self.__eq__(other)

commit_message:
fullstack: validate ipv6 as part of basic L2 connectivity

This patch validates IPv6 connectivity between vms on the
same network for various network_type combinations.

Partial-Bug: #1583028
Change-Id: I118675fee27d4105c0f5b5fb2a8c27c06042ed11

commit_message:
WIP: Remove OVS compilation for functional/fullstack jobs

The patch serves as a trigger for experimental jobs that currently run
on Ubuntu Xenial which already has OVS 2.5 with conntrack kernel
datapath support.

Change-Id: I28fca448cc60f1b7ba6ab1be7ce4a7594e7daf07

commit_message:
Add QoS bandwidth limit for instance ingress traffic

This patch introduces the new parameter "direction" to
the QoS bandwidth limit rule. It will allow the creation
of bandwidth limit rules for either ingress or egress
traffic. For backwards compatibility the default direction
will be egress.

DocImpact: Ingress bandwidth limit available for QoS
APIImpact: New type of parameter for QoS rule in neutron API

Change-Id: Iab86c77366bb3290c17f58f6a5a2a206414e49b6
Partial-Bug: #1560961

subject: neutron-dhcp-agent generates thousands of interfaces on a failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-23 18:23:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/29f525b2bb022817229f874a91b740e8d03475cb', 'message': "neutron-dhcp-agent generates thousands of interfaces on a failure

Currently the ensure_namespace method in ip_lib module determines
whether the namespace 'exists' or not with the output of the
command: ip -o netns list.

As reported in the bug, there may be cases where there may be an
empty namespace file in /run/netns but the namespace may not
actually exist. In such cases the dhcp agent throws an error
which isn't currently handled. It may also result in many tap
interfaces getting generated.

This patch fixes the above bug by modifying the ensure_namespace
method to additionally execute a command in the namespace:
ip netns exec <namespace> ip addr, in order to confirm that the
namespace does actually exist.

This handles the error thrown by add_device_to_namespace method
and also stops generating lots of tap interfaces.

commit_message:
neutron-dhcp-agent generates thousands of interfaces on a failure

Currently the exists method in IpNetnsCommand class of the ip_lib
module determines whether the namespace 'exists' or not with the
output of the command: ip -o netns list.

As reported in the bug, there may be cases where there may be an
empty namespace file in /run/netns but the namespace may not
actually exist. In such cases the dhcp agent throws an error
which isn't currently handled. It may also result in many tap
interfaces getting generated.

This patch fixes the above bug by modifying the exist method
to additionally execute a command in the namespace:
ip netns exec <namespace> ip addr, in order to confirm that the
namespace does actually exist.

This handles the error thrown by add_device_to_namespace method
resulting from non-existent namespaces and also stops generating
lots of tap interfaces.

Change-Id: I2015deb8dcd2b69755ac283e328ad1e6946311fe
Closes-Bug: #1561695
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/73/359373/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if self.netns.exists(name): if self.execute_namespace(name): ip = IPWrapper(namespace=name) else: self.netns.delete(name) ip = self.add_namespace(name) else: ip = self.add_namespace(name) def add_namespace(self, name): ip = self.netns.add(name) lo = ip.device(LOOPBACK_DEVNAME) lo.link.set_up() return ip def execute_namespace(self, name): try: utils.execute(['ip', 'netns', 'exec', name, 'ip', 'addr'], run_as_root=True, log_fail_as_error=self.log_fail_as_error) return True except RuntimeError: return False
deleted_lines: if not self.netns.exists(name): ip = self.netns.add(name) lo = ip.device(LOOPBACK_DEVNAME) lo.link.set_up() else: ip = IPWrapper(namespace=name)

subject: Spawn metadata proxy for DVR+HA routers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 03:19:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/813908f9b50655462906ac8584daf3805403eaf3', 'message': "Persist metadata proxy for dvr_snat l3-agent's backup routers

If a router on a dvr_snat-mode l3-agent is in backup state, the
l3-agent will destroy the metadata-proxy process in the router's
namespace. So if we run the dvr_snat l3-agent on a computer node
and a router is backup state, all instances binding with this
router on this node can't fetch metadata via http://169.254.169.254.

So make sure that the dvr_snat l3-agents won't destroy the metadata
proxy processes in the backup routers' namespaces can fix this bug.

Change-Id: I7350a991d2f2e778305d49483bcc82a8cf758d3a

namespace. So if we run the dvr_snat l3-agent on a computer node
and a router is backup state, all instances binding with this
router on this node can't fetch metadata via http://169.254.169.254.

So make sure that the dvr_snat l3-agents won't destroy the metadata
proxy processes in the backup routers' namespaces can fix this bug.

commit_message:
Spawn metadata proxy for DVR+HA routers

If we run L3 agent as dvr_snat mode in all nodes (include network
and compute nodes), when creating an ha + distributed router, L3 agent
will destroy metadata proxy in all backup nodes, this cause instances
in that nodes can't fetch metadata info via metadata proxy in router
namespace.

This patch permits standby dvr+ha routers to spawn metadata proxy.

Co-Authored-By: Dongcan Ye <hellochosen@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1606741
Change-Id: I7350a991d2f2e778305d49483bcc82a8cf758d3a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/86/352686/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: if state == 'master': LOG.debug('Spawning metadata proxy for router %s', router_id) self.metadata_driver.spawn_monitored_metadata_proxy( self.process_monitor, ri.ns_name, self.conf.metadata_port, self.conf, router_id=ri.router_id) else: LOG.debug('Closing metadata proxy for router %s', router_id) self.metadata_driver.destroy_monitored_metadata_proxy( self.process_monitor, ri.router_id, self.conf)

commit_message:
DNM: testing neutron jobs with tls enabled.

This is a big catchall test change to see what happens to neutron jobs
when you turn on tls-proxy in devstack.

Depends-On: I7c0b01a8b2ad4b7c1f6df9c920f9272b9b0d1033

commit_message:
Moving query builder methods to Subnet OVO

This patchset isolates model interrelationship under neutron/objects.
Query includes Subnet, SubnetServiceType and SegmentHostMapping models.
Since Subnet is of more relevance, query builder methods are being
moved to neutron/objects/subnet.py.

Change-Id: I2f687914fcb007240054304f69fffa7d085b8412
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/14/377114/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib.api import validators from sqlalchemy import and_, or_from neutron.db.models import subnet_service_type as sst_modelfrom neutron.services.segments import db as segment_svc_db from neutron.services.segments import exceptions as segment_exc @classmethod def find_candidate_subnets(cls, context, network_id, host, service_type): """Find canditate subnets for the network, host, and service_type""" query = cls.query_subnets_on_network(context, network_id) query = cls.query_filter_service_subnets(query, service_type) # Select candidate subnets and return them if not cls.is_host_set(host): # If the host isn't known, we can't allocate on a routed network. # So, exclude any subnets attached to segments. return cls.query_exclude_subnets_on_segments(query).all() # The host is known. Consider both routed and non-routed networks results = cls.query_filter_by_segment_host_mapping(query, host).all() # For now, we're using a simplifying assumption that a host will only # touch one segment in a given routed network. Raise exception # otherwise. This restriction may be relaxed as use cases for multiple # mappings are understood. segment_ids = {subnet.segment_id for subnet, mapping in results if mapping} if 1 < len(segment_ids): raise segment_exc.HostConnectedToMultipleSegments( host=host, network_id=network_id) return [subnet for subnet, _mapping in results] @staticmethod def is_host_set(host): """Utility to tell if the host is set in the port binding""" # This seems redundant, but its not. Host is unset if its None, '', # or ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED due to differences in host binding # implementations. return host and validators.is_attr_set(host) @classmethod def query_subnets_on_network(cls, context, network_id): query = cls._get_collection_query(context, models_v2.Subnet) return query.filter(models_v2.Subnet.network_id == network_id) @classmethod def query_filter_service_subnets(cls, query, service_type): ServiceType = sst_model.SubnetServiceType query = query.add_entity(ServiceType) query = query.outerjoin(ServiceType) query = query.filter(or_(ServiceType.service_type.is_(None), ServiceType.service_type == service_type)) return query.from_self(models_v2.Subnet) @staticmethod def query_filter_by_segment_host_mapping(query, host): """Excludes subnets on segments not reachable by the host The query gets two kinds of subnets: those that are on segments that the host can reach and those that are not on segments at all (assumed reachable by all hosts). Hence, subnets on segments that the host *cannot* reach are excluded. """ Subnet = models_v2.Subnet SegmentHostMapping = segment_svc_db.SegmentHostMapping # A host has been provided. Consider these two scenarios # 1. Not a routed network: subnets are not on segments # 2. Is a routed network: only subnets on segments mapped to host # The following join query returns results for either. The two are # guaranteed to be mutually exclusive when subnets are created. query = query.add_entity(SegmentHostMapping) query = query.outerjoin( SegmentHostMapping, and_(Subnet.segment_id == SegmentHostMapping.segment_id, SegmentHostMapping.host == host)) # Essentially "segment_id IS NULL XNOR host IS NULL" query = query.filter(or_(and_(Subnet.segment_id.isnot(None), SegmentHostMapping.host.isnot(None)), and_(Subnet.segment_id.is_(None), SegmentHostMapping.host.is_(None)))) return query @staticmethod def query_exclude_subnets_on_segments(query): """Excludes all subnets associated with segments For the case where the host is not known, we don't consider any subnets that are on segments. But, we still consider subnets that are not associated with any segment (i.e. for non-routed networks). """ return query.filter(models_v2.Subnet.segment_id.is_(None))

commit_message:
No more implicit conversion to unicode/str

From the oslo.log usage, error should be converted to unicode either
by calling six.text_type() or by using a unicode formatting string to
provide contex.[1]

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.log/usage.html#
    no-more-implicit-conversion-to-unicode-str
Closes-Bug: #1529534

Change-Id: Ifd9a69501534a691b56a6e30024382296e2f03aa

subject: HA: Avoid multiple port binding by agents
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-28 11:06:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c58180bb15e054a50fcb6ca31ca20162c2f675bc', 'message': 'HA: Avoid multiple port binding by agents

During router_interface_add, all HA agents try to bind port(
to master if active host found else to themselves),
if not already bound.
The check to identify port bound or not, may fail for some agents,
if all agents try to bind port at same time.
For example, if two agents get interface details "at same time" and
then first agent called bind_port(for master host), then second agent
still see that port not bound and calls bind_port(again for master host)

This can be avoided by calling get_port in _ensure_host_set_on_port,
so that latest bind info is available at _ensure_host_set_on_port.

With this change still we may see multiple bind calls, for example,
if agent calls get_port before port binding from other agent
got completed. So to avoid multiple port binding it is better to call
port binding(if master host is avialable) in plugin before notifying
agents about router interface add.

commit_message:
HA: Avoid multiple port binding by agents

During router_interface_add, all HA agents try to bind port(
to master if active host found else to themselves),
if not already bound. This may create race in port binding and
port status not updated properly because of invalid host and remain
in BUILD status.

Before calling port update, we check for latest bind info on port,
by calling get_port. Also it is better to call port bind in plugin
before notifying agents about router interface add, to avoid
multiple port binding

Closes-Bug: #1590845
Closes-Bug: #1488015
Change-Id: I9a4f8c2fd19eab07df80f261ea4d2cc2e0db2d2d

subject: fix inconsistend and useless data for unbound port
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-18 10:59:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/89835759bf926800467e765e8377d6c9be7f4f0c', 'message': "WIP not add address-set and acl for unbound port

Currently, networking-ovn will update ACL and Address_Set every time
a port is created. It's valid for a port with device_owner 'compute:None',
which means this is a VM port. But this is not the same to a port has
empty device_owner, which means it could be an unbound port.

Since a port is unbound, all ACL entries using its information in their
match are meaningless, it make sense not to update Address_Set and ACL
for an unbound port.

An unbound port may change its device_owner to 'compute:None' or
'network:router_interface'. When it turns to be a VM port, we should
update Address_Set and ACL for it, while it turns to be a router port,
nothing update for it in OVN table Address_Set and ACL.

TODO:
 - file a bug for this
 - update commit message
 - update UT

Change-Id: I61f2b88a3a6d06747f476d753e34fd02acbfe01d
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-19 13:57:54.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/ovn_db_sync.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/test_ovn_db_sync.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/c01edd656910ae9761869fff24ad14f5e4b31f01', 'message': "fix inconsistend and useless data for unbound port

Currently, networking-ovn will update ACL and Address_Set for an unbound
port, and when an unbound port turns to a router interface port, its
relevant records in table ACL and Address_Set, and Logical_Switch_Port.
port_security column will be kept, that's an inconsistent behavior, and
it will generate useless data for OVN to deal with.

And for an unbound port, it's also meaningless to have its mac, IP addresses
and port id in OVN tables and columns, since it's still in unbound state.

This patch add some device_owner checking to confirm it's a VM port before
insert port info into the tables and columns mentioned above.

Closes-Bug: #1604426
Change-Id: I61f2b88a3a6d06747f476d753e34fd02acbfe01d
"}]
commit_message:
fix inconsistend and useless data for unbound port

Currently, networking-ovn will update ACL and Address_Set for an unbound
port, and when an unbound port turns to a router interface port, its
relevant records in table ACL and Address_Set, and Logical_Switch_Port.
port_security column will be kept, that's an inconsistent behavior, and
it will generate useless data for OVN to deal with.

And for an unbound port, it's also meaningless to have its mac, IP addresses
and port id in OVN tables and columns, since it's still in unbound state.

This patch add some device_owner checking to confirm it's a VM port before
insert port info into the tables and columns mentioned above.

Closes-Bug: #1604426
Change-Id: I61f2b88a3a6d06747f476d753e34fd02acbfe01d

deleted_lines: acls_new = ovn_acl.add_acls(self._plugin, admin_context, port, sg_cache, subnet_cache) for acl in acls_new: txn.add(self._nb_ovn.add_acl(**acl)) sg_ids = port.get('security_groups', []) if port.get('fixed_ips') and sg_ids: addresses = ovn_acl.acl_port_ips(port) for sg_id in sg_ids: for ip_version in addresses: if addresses[ip_version]: txn.add(self._nb_ovn.update_address_set( name=utils.ovn_addrset_name(sg_id, ip_version), addrs_add=addresses[ip_version], addrs_remove=None)) acls_new = ovn_acl.add_acls(self._plugin, admin_context, port, sg_cache, subnet_cache) for acl in acls_new: txn.add(self._nb_ovn.add_acl(**acl))

commit_message:
Add OVS agent support remote VXLAN VTEP

With this patch OVS agent can create VXLAN tunnel with a remote unicast VTEPs.

Co-Authored-By: ruansx@cn.ibm.com
Co-Authored-By: nazhu@cn.ibm.com

Please help review:
Spec:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/282180

Neutron server code change:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/315896

neutron client code patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/286504

DocImpact
APIImpact

Change-Id: Idecda1f07fe323bd109fb9d3a08d86038aa6e455
Partial-Bug: #1525059

added_lines: def test_create_router_vxlan_gw_tunnel(self): self.agent.local_vlan_map['net_id_2'] = \ ovs_agent.LocalVLANMapping(1000, 'vxlan', None, 4000) self.agent.local_ip = '20.0.0.123' port_detail = {'network_id': 'net_id_2', 'admin_state_up': True, 'device_owner': 'network:router_gateway', 'port_id': 'port_id_2', 'network_type': 'vxlan', 'physical_network': None, 'flooding_vtep': [{'dstport': 4788, 'ip_address': '20.0.0.124'}], 'admin_state_up': True, 'segmentation_id': 4000} with mock.patch.object(self.agent, 'tun_br') as tun_br, \ mock.patch.object(self.agent, 'vxlan_gw_ports') as vxlan_gw_ports, \ mock.patch.object(self.agent, 'vxlan_gw_tunnels') as vxlan_gw_tunnels: self.agent._create_router_vxlan_gw_tunnel(port_detail) self.assertTrue(tun_br.add_tunnel_port.called) self.assertTrue(tun_br.setup_tunnel_port.called) self.assertTrue(vxlan_gw_ports['net_id_2'].get('tun_br_ports')) self.assertTrue(vxlan_gw_tunnels.get('20.0.0.124')) def test_router_vxlan_gw_port_delete(self): self.agent.vxlan_gw_ports['net_id_2'] = \ {'int_br_ports': set(['int_port_id_2']), 'tun_br_ports': set([2])} self.agent.vxlan_gw_tunnels['20.0.0.124'] = \ {'ofport': 2, 'net_list': set(['net_id_2'])} with mock.patch.object(self.agent, 'get_net_uuid', return_value='net_id_2'): self.agent._router_vxlan_gw_port_delete('int_port_id_2') gw_ports = self.agent.vxlan_gw_ports.get('net_id_2') gw_tunnel = self.agent.vxlan_gw_tunnels.get('20.0.0.124') self.assertEqual(gw_ports, None) self.assertEqual(gw_tunnel, None)

commit_message:
Add Linux bridge agent support remote VXLAN VTEP

Current linux bridge agent create VXLAN tunnel with a multicast group,
with this patch linux bridge agent can create VXLAN tunnel with a
remote unicast VTEP.

Please help review:
Spec:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/282180

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/315896

neutron client code patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/286504

https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1525059

Change-Id: I1c6f6410cbf79d4999a8ff3dddd6c88b2c222a43
Partial-Bug: #1525059

commit_message:
Updated api-ref configuration

The os-api-ref 1.0.0 is out. We can remove the support to older
version now.

Change-Id: I723c2ee3806be751853e89cb512b6acb9d939ec5

subject: Clean conntrack entries with a separate thread worker
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-19 07:25:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/d98a085032be39f23a3e7f979d78e4131a69e33b', 'message': "Clean conntrack entries with a separate thead worker

When we delete a security group memeber, the l2 agents will clean
related conntrack entries, but using CLI command 'conntrack' in
l2 agents is expensive, and it also slows down regular dataplane
wiring.
This patch adds a separate thead worker to clean the conntrack entries.

Change-Id: I4c5d0f3174fc8344cf79a4ba957f0a0180d092a0
Closes-bug: #1513765
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-20 03:22:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2263008f8dea021529cde8361267dff9f0c1b18a', 'message': "Clean conntrack entries with a separate thread worker

When we delete a security group member, the l2 agents will clean
related conntrack entries, but using CLI command 'conntrack' in
l2 agents is expensive, and it also slows down regular dataplane
wiring.
This patch adds a separate thread worker to clean the conntrack entries.

Change-Id: I4c5d0f3174fc8344cf79a4ba957f0a0180d092a0
Closes-bug: #1513765
"}]
commit_message:
Clean conntrack entries with a separate thread worker

When we delete a security group member, the l2 agents will clean
related conntrack entries, but using CLI command 'conntrack' in
l2 agents is expensive, and it also slows down regular dataplane
wiring.
This patch adds a separate thread worker to clean the conntrack entries.

Change-Id: I4c5d0f3174fc8344cf79a4ba957f0a0180d092a0
Closes-bug: #1513765
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/90/388490/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import threading def _clean_conntrack_entries(): self._clean_deleted_sg_rule_conntrack_entries() self._clean_updated_sg_member_conntrack_entries() self._clean_deleted_remote_sg_members_conntrack_entries() clean_thread = threading.Thread(target=_clean_conntrack_entries) clean_thread.setDaemon(True) clean_thread.start()

commit_message:
Support provider:flooding_vtep in ML2

The provider flooding vteps is a list, each member of the list can be
ip unicast address or (ip unicast address, vxlan port number) tuple.

It is an extension attribute of ML2, and it is only available
for VXLAN network

The spec of about this feature is
https://review.openstack.org/282180

The neutron-client change is
https://review.openstack.org/286504

DocImpact
APIImpact

Change-Id: Ib345c3cc4430f4b53bf86ee1fc98e263a100a628
Partial-Bug: #1525059

commit_message:
Add support to filter OVSDB columns

Add support to OVSDB Connection class to filter IDL schema by columns,
within tables, and not only by entire tables.

Change-Id: I292dbedf292557b12336eb1af5cfa6909159e70e
Closes-Bug: 1612403
Co-Authored-By: Terry Wilson <twilson@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/31/329031/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _test_start(self, wfc, idl, gsh, tq, table_name_list=None, table_name_columns={}): self.connection.start( table_name_list=table_name_list, table_name_columns=table_name_columns, ) reg_table_called = bool( table_name_list is not None and not table_name_columns ) reg_columns_called = bool( table_name_list is not None and table_name_columns ) self.assertEqual(reg_columns_called, helper.register_columns.called) @helpers.requires_py2 def test_start_with_table_name_list_and_columns(self): table_name_columns = { 'fake-table1': ['fake-col1', 'fake-col2'], 'fake-table2': ['fake-col3', 'fake-col4'], } self._test_start( table_name_list=table_name_columns.keys(), table_name_columns=table_name_columns )
deleted_lines: def _test_start(self, wfc, idl, gsh, tq, table_name_list=None): self.connection.start(table_name_list=table_name_list) reg_table_called = table_name_list is not None

commit_message:
journal: try next oldest row on invalid dependency

When invalid dependency is found, the row should be skipped when
try to pick journal row instead of repeating same row.

Change-Id: I5f70a12c47d74d0987d0bb290cc7fe8dd863185c

subject: Forbidding metering label synced to unrelated meter-agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-26 09:17:57.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/services/metering/test_metering_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/metering/metering_db.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9aa3e6c79c21376a30c8144f6ede1136b8b72f1c', 'message': "Forbidding metering label synced to unrelated meter-agent

When metering-agent run sync_routers_task, it maybe get some
unrelated meter label, which tenant's router related metering
label didn't scheduler to metering-agent's host, When collecting
sample for unrelated meter label, it will cause error for router's
namespace didn't exist. the patch will filter metering label use
router scheduler to metering-agent's host.

Change-Id: Ic4d0cb47e7b6ba8568e3d6ebe96fd68ddca3d47b
Closes-bug: #1617215
"}]
commit_message:
Forbidding metering label synced to unrelated meter-agent

When metering-agent run sync_routers_task, it maybe get some
unrelated meter label, which tenant's router related metering
label didn't scheduler to metering-agent's host, When collecting
sample for unrelated meter label, it will cause error for router's
namespace didn't exist. the patch will filter metering label use
router scheduler to metering-agent's host.

Change-Id: Ic4d0cb47e7b6ba8568e3d6ebe96fd68ddca3d47b
Closes-bug: #1617215

commit_message:
Allow deletion of ERRORed load balancers

The API was not allowing the deletion of load balancers in ERROR state.
Users should be able to delete their load balancers in ACTIVE or ERROR
state.  This is good for users and good for operators.

Closes-Bug: #1607502

Conflicts:
	octavia/tests/functional/db/test_repositories.py

Change-Id: If1587e25d5f79c136d3aec4e129a8227dddbce3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/11/351011/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
v2driver: postcommit directly sync journal entry

Make postcommit directly sync journal entry when possible.
With this, journal back log would be reduced at the cost of
performance reduction of neutron api.

Change-Id: Id6aa186dd2f033cee5ae5938fc14c326a9e95a6f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/34/355134/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: row_dict = journal.record(context._plugin_context.session, object_type, context.current['id'], operation, data) # NOTE(yamahata): work around to pass row_dict to postcommit # https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1592238 # [RFE] ml2: needs a way for MD to pass data from precommit to # postcommit Edit context.current['_odl_row_dict'] = row_dict if not cfg.CONF.ml2_odl.enable_postcommit_sync: return session = context._plugin_context.session if session.is_active: # NOTE(yamahata): sometime ml2 plugin is called under # db transaction unfortunately with contract violated. # e.g. l3 plugin, ipam. # In that case, we can't block. LOG.debug("nested plugin call. skipping direct sync") return row_dict = context.current['_odl_row_dict'] self.journal.wait(session, row_dict)

commit_message:
Provide a property to access the integration bridge for OVS

br_int or int_br may lead to confusion as witnessed during a
recent code review. We should provide a path to accessing this
variable that is less prone to human errors.

This patch turns int_br into a private attribute of the OVS
agent class and introduces properties in preparation of the
more extensive cleanup needed when Ocata opens up.

Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

Change-Id: If2bbfa47927323b66d73d163a1c7161443157409

commit_message:
api-ref: Fix api-ref for subnets

Added request/response parameters for the rest_method::
   GET /v2.0/subnets
   POST /v2.0/subnets (Create Subnet)
   POST /v2.0/subnets (Bulk Create Subnet)
   GET /v2.0/subnets/{subnet_id} (Show Subnet Details)
   PUT /v2.0/subnets/{subnet_id} (Update Subnet)
   DELETE /v2.0/subnets/{subnet_id} (Delete Subnet)

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I7cfba70c6805161ee9e26135fe08f5075e94d755
Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-in-tree-api-ref
Partial-Bug: #1613151
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/82/358282/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The ID of the subnet.subnet-allocation_pools: description: | Allocation pool IP addresses for this subnet. in: body required: true type: array subnet-dns_nameservers: description: | List of dns name servers associated with the subnet. in: body required: true type: array subnet-enable_dhcp: description: | Indicates whether dhcp is enabled or disabled for the subnet. Default ``true``. in: body required: true type: boolean subnet-gateway_ip: description: | Gateway IP of this subnet. in: body required: true type: string subnet-host_routes: description: | Additional routes for the subnet. A list of dictionaries with ``destination`` and ``nexthop`` parameters. in: body required: true type: array subnet-id-body: description: | The ID of the subnet. in: body required: true type: string subnet-name: description: | Human-readable name of the resource. in: body required: true type: string subnet-network_id: description: | The ID of the network to which the subnet belongs.. in: body required: true type: stringsubnets_2: description: | A list of ``subnet`` objects. in: body required: true type: array

api-ref: Update local_id configuration

Adding local_id configuration support to api-ref with respect to the
changes made in this commit 7cf4ef682f83fc08484011454f62c27882064dff.

commit_message:
api-ref: Correcting Network v2.0 API extensions

This patch corrects Network v2.0 API extensions:
- Change 'extensions' type from 'object' to 'array'
- Change '{alias}' parameter from 'in:body' to 'in:path'
Refactor code

Change-Id: I2e64669224ab4a970c17cc192abdf08519b1576f
Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-in-tree-api-ref

commit_message:
Add section headings to Neutron API Reference

This commit adds section headings to the Neutron API reference similar
to how the Nova API reference groups related API calls. This is in
preparation for two commits in progress to add sets of API calls
related to BGP VPNs and Service Function Chaining as well as any other
Neutron stadium projects which will bring groups of related API calls
into the neutron-lib API reference.

Change-Id: I1a61e614fa2d8280910cf5af5bd9d8e25ebbbc8a

commit_message:
comment: remove unused comment

When we use ceilometer-upgrade, we get the same gnocchi resources as
gnocchi-upgrade produces. To avoid confusing people with the duplicate
resources, we will drop the gnocchi side. So the comment has no sense.

Change-Id: Id5e31e3c2015a65d63a7ad787a93036c6214c279

commit_message:
Add '--network' and other options to floating ip list

The patch adds filtering '--network', '--port',
'--fixed-ip-address' options to floating ip list command

Partial-Bug: #1614379
Change-Id: I82319d0985d9e864431097c90264a20bf88167cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/72/395472/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Add ``--port``, ``--floating-ip-address``, ``--fixed-ip-address``, and ``network`` options to ``floating ip list`` command [Bug `1614379 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1614379>`_]

subject: Implement zero downtime upgrades
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-10 03:04:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone/commit/1c750099364e5ac3b4b5636f1a86fce6ffd48b1b', 'message': 'Implement zero downtime upgrades

This patch implements upgrading keystone with zero downtime as the
default installation process. Handlers have been modified to ensure that
the first keystone node is stopped, facilitates the database migrations,
and that it is started and available before restarting any other keystone
nodes.

This process is documented at
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/upgrading.html#upgrading-without-downtime

Depends-On: I17d5bba2a81911b74ad5d23687cfc7a7ed81feb4
Change-Id: I0d3cfcb80b64d005d60f4c8445f991855f844796
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-10 03:05:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone/commit/e18dbdd362fe86794125bf2ac156d0379cf1d5bb', 'message': 'Implement zero downtime upgrades

default installation process. Handlers have been modified to ensure that
the first keystone node is stopped, facilitates the database migrations,

nodes.

This process is documented at
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/upgrading.html#upgrading-without-downtime

This patch implements upgrading keystone with zero downtime as the
default installation process. Handlers have been modified to ensure that
the first keystone node is stopped, facilitates the database migrations,
and that it is started and available before restarting any other keystone
nodes. Migrations also now only occur when there is a change within the
installed keystone venv.

This process is documented at
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/upgrading.html#upgrading-without-downtime

commit_message:
Implement zero downtime upgrades

This patch implements upgrading keystone with zero downtime as the
default installation process. Handlers have been modified to ensure that
the first keystone node is stopped, facilitates the database migrations,
and that it is started and available before restarting any other keystone
nodes. Migrations also now only occur when there is a change within the
installed keystone venv.

This process is documented at
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/upgrading.html#upgrading-without-downtime

A new test scenario has been added for testing basic upgradability
between releases.

Implements: blueprint upgrade-testing
Change-Id: I0d3cfcb80b64d005d60f4c8445f991855f844796

commit_message:
Nested keys handled for get operation

Nested key can be specified with '.' separator: key1.key2.key3.
Nested keys handled in the API and in the fuel2.
Tests for keys operations moved from the test for resource values
to the test for resource key operations.

Change-Id: I73b5fd9a4a4720a96af351d7e6a7cea14d816f75
Partial-Bug: #1642330
(cherry picked from commit 22ea50db292ddc4c085e1ad0c96b2ee879e7d591)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tuning-box refs/changes/26/399726/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_resource_values_get_nested_keys(self): self.app.config["PROPAGATE_EXCEPTIONS"] = True self._fixture() environment_id = 9 res_def_id = 5 levels = (('lvl1', 'val1'), ('lvl2', 'val2')) values = {'k0': 'v0', 'k1': {'k2': 'v12', 'k3': 'v13', 'k4': [{'k5': 'v1405'}, 'v141']}, 'k6': [{'k7': [{'k8': 'v60708'}]}]} self._add_resource_values(environment_id, res_def_id, levels, values) obj_url = self.object_url.format( environment_id, self.get_levels_path(levels), res_def_id ) res = self.client.get(obj_url, query_string={'key': 'k0'}) self.assertEqual(200, res.status_code) self.assertEqual('v0', res.json) # Getting nested key res = self.client.get(obj_url, query_string={'key': 'k1.k2'}) self.assertEqual(200, res.status_code) self.assertEqual('v12', res.json) # Getting nested key from the list res = self.client.get(obj_url, query_string={'key': 'k1.k4.0'}) self.assertEqual(200, res.status_code) self.assertEqual({'k5': 'v1405'}, res.json) # Getting nested key from nested lists res = self.client.get(obj_url, query_string={'key': 'k6.0.k7.0.k8'}) self.assertEqual(200, res.status_code) self.assertEqual('v60708', res.json) # Getting nested key effective value res = self.client.get(obj_url, query_string={'key': 'k0', 'effective': 1}) self.assertEqual(200, res.status_code) self.assertEqual('v0', res.json) res = self.client.get(obj_url, query_string={'key': 'k1.k2', 'effective': 1}) self.assertEqual(200, res.status_code) self.assertEqual('v12', res.json) # Getting nested key value with lookup res = self.client.get( obj_url, query_string={'key': 'k0', 'effective': 1, 'show_lookup': 1} ) self.assertEqual(200, res.status_code) self.assertEqual(['v0', '/lvl1/val1/lvl2/val2/'], res.json) res = self.client.get( obj_url, query_string={'key': 'k1.k2', 'effective': 1, 'show_lookup': 1} ) self.assertEqual(200, res.status_code) self.assertEqual(['v12', '/lvl1/val1/lvl2/val2/'], res.json) def test_resource_values_get_nested_keys_not_found(self): self.app.config["PROPAGATE_EXCEPTIONS"] = True self._fixture() environment_id = 9 res_def_id = 5 levels = (('lvl1', 'val1'), ('lvl2', 'val2')) values = {'k0': 'v0'} self._add_resource_values(environment_id, res_def_id, levels, values) obj_url = self.object_url.format( environment_id, self.get_levels_path(levels), res_def_id ) res = self.client.get(obj_url, query_string={'key': 'k0'}) self.assertEqual(200, res.status_code) self.assertEqual('v0', res.json) res = self.client.get(obj_url, query_string={'key': 'k1'}) self.assertEqual(409, res.status_code) res = self.client.get(obj_url, query_string={'key': 'k1.k2'}) self.assertEqual(409, res.status_code)

commit_message:
Move IP logic into separate module

This patch moves the IP logic into a module separate from the overall
code. Ideally, this will serve as a way to abstract IP information
handling to be populated by pluggable backends in addition to existing
logic.

Further work is needed to remove various code smells from tests and provide a
more consistent public API that could be adopted as more generic.

Change-Id: I09a57c43064eca46f776e941cbedb2296f43fbbc

added_lines: import netaddr import Queue import random import logging logger = logging.getLogger('osa-inventory-ip') USED_IPS = set() def get_ip_address(name, ip_q): """Return an IP address from our IP Address queue.""" try: ip_addr = ip_q.get(timeout=1) while ip_addr in USED_IPS: ip_addr = ip_q.get(timeout=1) else: USED_IPS.add(ip_addr) return str(ip_addr) except AttributeError: return None except Queue.Empty: raise SystemExit( 'Cannot retrieve requested amount of IP addresses. Increase the %s' ' range in your openstack_user_config.yml.' % name ) def load_ip_q(cidr, ip_q): """Load the IP queue with all IP address from a given cidr. :param cidr: ``str`` IP address with cidr notation """ _all_ips = [str(i) for i in list(netaddr.IPNetwork(cidr))] base_exclude = [ str(netaddr.IPNetwork(cidr).network), str(netaddr.IPNetwork(cidr).broadcast) ] USED_IPS.update(base_exclude) for ip in random.sample(_all_ips, len(_all_ips)): if ip not in USED_IPS: ip_q.put(ip) def load_optional_q(config, cidr_name): """Load optional queue with ip addresses. :param config: ``dict`` User defined information :param cidr_name: ``str`` Name of the cidr name """ cidr = config.get(cidr_name) ip_q = None if cidr is not None: ip_q = Queue.Queue() load_ip_q(cidr=cidr, ip_q=ip_q) return ip_q def set_used_ips(user_defined_config, inventory): """Set all of the used ips into a global list. :param user_defined_config: ``dict`` User defined configuration :param inventory: ``dict`` Living inventory of containers and hosts """ used_ips = user_defined_config.get('used_ips') if isinstance(used_ips, list): for ip in used_ips: split_ip = ip.split(',') if len(split_ip) >= 2: ip_range = list( netaddr.iter_iprange( split_ip[0], split_ip[-1] ) ) USED_IPS.update([str(i) for i in ip_range]) else: logger.debug("IP %s set as used", split_ip[0]) USED_IPS.add(split_ip[0]) # Find all used IP addresses and ensure that they are not used again for host_entry in inventory['_meta']['hostvars'].values(): networks = host_entry.get('container_networks', dict()) for network_entry in networks.values(): address = network_entry.get('address') if address: logger.debug("IP %s set as used", address) USED_IPS.add(address)

commit_message:
devstack: create public network connectivity

On l3 node br-ex isn't connected to public network.
create veth pair, connect it to br-ex and setup routing table for
floating ips.
Thus network connectivity to public network and host is setup.

Change-Id: Ibc45e5771ce07e20b91d503102d28076ed8e18aa

commit_message:
Have scenario tests use ipv4

The scenario tests currently use the first ip address (or in the
case of clusters, all) that is found. Unfortunately some datastores
don't support IPV6, so if a non-ipv4 ip is used, the test will fail.
Until all datastores support IPV6 (or we can come up with a strategy
to intelligently decide which to use) we should only use the IPV4 ips,
so the tests have been changed to accomodate this.

Closes-Bug: 1642741
Depends-On: Ia4fc545a10c7c16532aefd73818dd7d90c9c271b
Change-Id: I6aff776680c9c0632d8965c3ed70ed26db0a63f2

commit_message:
Fix race condition in cluster-show

There is a race condition in showing a cluster wherein the
server gets the list of instances from the db and then iterates
over the list to get the server information. If a shrink
operation is in progress, it can happen that one of the
instances is no longer present when trying to retrieve
the server info, and this causes the show command to throw
a NotFound error.

This is now trapped and the 'missing' server excluded from the list.

Change-Id: I54edc4acac09ca2278f525c08ad0d87576f0549e
Closee-Bug: 1643002

commit_message:
Use default Sensu redact

By default sensu-puppet is overring default list of varibles which should
be redacted. This patch enables to configure redact list and uses default
value given by [1]. This patch also serves as a workaround until [2]
is merged in the module itself (or in case it won't get merged).

[1] https://sensuapp.org/docs/0.24/reference/clients.html
[2] https://github.com/sensu/sensu-puppet/pull/580

Closes-Bug: #1641080
Closes-Bug: rhbz#1392473
Change-Id: I21201f734d2fbf5f571091603126cf11cfdd8c40
(cherry picked from commit c921b15c905eb609f0a3e1bd5943e24da46f549f)

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for Ocata 2016-11-18

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available SHA's,
updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's and also updates the
appropriate python requirements pins.

NB Ceilometer has not been updated to it's latest SHA due to the
requirements bump for kafka-python which doesn't match the
global-requirements version.

Change-Id: I646c55d1a90c2b207ab230e1f50f219d2efbac64

This reverts commit 8baf0b8fcbfc7fe13e4a714fe488294c0796b81c.

commit_message:
Fix error case where server.fault is missing

Some times when there's a server error, there is no
'fault' attribute on the server record.  This caused
Trove to throw an exception.  This has been fixed.

Change-Id: I47cbe9e899cb0767c377d184f123e38eda5b6a05
Depends-On: Ia4fc545a10c7c16532aefd73818dd7d90c9c271b
Closes-Bug: #1642636

added_lines: server_fault_message = 'No fault found' try: server_fault_message = server.fault.get('message', 'Unknown') except AttributeError: pass server_message = "\nServer error: %s" % server_fault_message
deleted_lines: server_message = '' if server.fault: server_message = "\nServer error: %s" % ( server.fault.get('message', 'Unknown'))

commit_message:
Fix passing incorrect args to logging

Change I7b1cd98aeb3bb8f4f01dd1d69d1afcd839749074 removed
the % from the logging call without removing the parenthesis.
This patch fix that.

Change-Id: Ifb2f85c6cce5e074bed327d47dcacd509aa2dafe

commit_message:
Enable Kuryr driver

Allow Kuryr to be used as network driver

Add Kuryr as an allowed network driver for Swarm
so that a cluster-template with Kuryr can be created:

magnum cluster-template-create --network-driver kuryr ...

Then a cluster can be created using this cluster-template
Also update user guide, more details coming.

Partially implements: blueprint kuryr-swarm-integration
Change-Id: I5db85dbc44053d899c67d6676f7810bd33e4930c

commit_message:
Add route to Neutron private network

Neutron no longer provide access to private network.
We need to add route manually to have ability to contact
with VM during provisioning.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/397987/

Closes-Bug: #1642986
Change-Id: If281a1d6bc0fdaf48c4cfb8d923f7b1761f8162c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/32/399632/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(vsaienko) Neutron no longer setup routing to private netwrok. # https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/commit/1493bdeba24674f6634160d51b8081c571df4017 # Add route here to have connection to VMs during provisioning. ROUTER_GW_IP=$(openstack --os-cloud devstack-admin --os-region "$REGION_NAME" port list -c 'Fixed IP Addresses' --device-owner network:router_gateway | awk -F'ip_address' '{ print $2 }' | cut -f2 -d\' | tr '\n' ' ') local replace_range=${SUBNETPOOL_PREFIX_V4} if [[ -z "${SUBNETPOOL_V4_ID}" ]]; then replace_range=${FIXED_RANGE} fi sudo ip route replace $replace_range via $ROUTER_GW_IP

commit_message:
Use 'code-block' for pieces of code

'code-block' improves the visibility for the pieces of code.  This
commit splits code and result message by using 'code-block: python' and
'code-block: console'.

Change-Id: Id11e0990da4dae8d47c6de7d19479cb9940890b2

commit_message:
use a shorter path to release-tools

Use a path short enough that we don't run into length limits when
building command lines using the full path.

Change-Id: Id4e28e343e9e38317b58c5ee7ee7bf5a1c953de7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/55/399755/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: TOOLS_TMP=$HOME/release-tools TOOLS_TMP=$HOME/release-tools

[Docs] Refactor auditd rules

This patch adds documentation for:

  https://review.openstack.org/397334

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I5dc47cae51321c35592451030c54b2875c46be45
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/55/397355/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: status: implemented tag: auditdRules are added to audit all ``truncate`` syscalls on the system. Deployers can opt out of this change by setting an Ansible variable: .. code-block:: yaml security_rhel7_audit_truncate: no This rule is compatible with x86, x86_64, and ppc64 architectures.
deleted_lines: status: not implemented tag: miscThis STIG requirement is not yet implemented.

commit_message:
Refactor auditd rules

This commit adds all of the remaining audit rules to the role and
refactors the audit rules (mostly) into a list that jinja2 can
loop over.

Docs will be in a follow-on patch.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I17ca6356ae7819f0721585850e4d70e0bac29ff1

commit_message:
Revert role SHA pin for Ocata-2 development

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/399561/ pinned the SHA's for the
Ocata-1 deliverable.

This patch unpins the SHA's so that development can continue, working
towards the Ocata-3 release.

Change-Id: I01c83cc2e20c5c621f5fda065f1f92edfd9711dd

commit_message:
Simplify cert-ramfs-ecrypt package dependencies

We only need ecryptfs-utils, as package managers will take care of the
sub-dependencies. Tested on an Ubuntu amphora, installed packages list
was identical.
This also fixes image creation on Fedora, as ecryptfs-utils package name
is identical there

Change-Id: Idab8c66e6bca137e79bef050fbaecd2f6c4add7a
Closes-Bug: #1640832
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/30/399630/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
encryptors: Mock os_brick.executor correctly

Previously the encryptor test classes would mock the privileged rootwrap
executor directly in the setUp method of each class. This will
potentially race and is not required when mocking out execute calls
within os_brick.

This change also introduces a BaseEncryptorTestCase test class to avoid
duplicate runs of the various get_encryptors test methods.

Change-Id: I170fbcc07672c9c77b613c1eb84bcefbcd42ce77
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/33/397933/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _create(self): return nop.NoOpEncryptor(root_helper=self.root_helper, connection_info=self.connection_info, keymgr=self.keymgr)
deleted_lines: def _create(self, root_helper, connection_info, keymgr, execute): return nop.NoOpEncryptor(root_helper=root_helper, connection_info=connection_info, keymgr=keymgr, execute=execute)

commit_message:
enable an xfs tmpdir for swift tests

Builder added:
 - mount-xfs-tmp-space: takes a path, creates a 1G file there,
   and loopback-mounts it to a passed in path
 - tox-with-tmpdir-passed-in: a copy of the tox job, but with an
   extra {new_tmpdir_loc} value passed in and TMPDIR set

projects.yaml changes (for swift):
 - replaced 'gate-{name}-tox-{envlist}-{node}' for
   'gate-{name}-tox-xfs-tmp-{envlist}-{node}' and placed
   'py27' and 'py34' envlist entries under it

scripts updated:
 - run-tox.sh: now only sets TMPDIR if it's currently unset

job-template updates:
 - create 'gate-{name}-tox-xfs-tmp-{envlist}-{node}' that is a copy
   of 'gate-{name}-tox-{envlist}' but calls 'mount-xfs-tmp-space'
   before dropping sudo. Then it calls 'tox-with-tmpdir-passed-in'
   instead of 'tox'

zuul/layouy.yaml updates:
 - added the "with xfs" tox jobs to swift

Change-Id: I3339de0d57726b339dfc6638d225e49d097f7b63

commit_message:
Move clamav packages to rhel7 vars

The package variables for clamav somehow ended up in the RHEL 6 vars. This
patch puts them in the right place.

Change-Id: I48705bbb79367fa60745e98850652c0331537322

commit_message:
Enable keystone authentication for k8s bay

K8s already supports Keystone authenication [1]. Magnum should
have an option to configure the k8s bay for using Keystone.

As an initial step, this patch propose a way to add support for
this option via baymodel labels. Operator can set keystone as
the authentication method using 'kube_auth' label like
'--labels kube_auth=keystone'.

Later, if swarm and mesos supports Keystone as well, we might bring
the option to baymodel as an attribute (instead of labels).

[1] http://kubernetes.io/docs/admin/authentication/

Change-Id: Ibaa2e02e7624740069456319426797424716676c
Implements: blueprint keystone-for-k8s-bay
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/24/326924/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: kube_auth: type: string description: > The authentication method k8s uses, can only be set as keystone at this point, if not set, client certificate authentication will be used. constraints: - allowed_values: ["keystone"] "$KUBE_AUTH": {get_param: kube_auth}
